docs.lead_paragraph: While marijuana is not harmless, it is less dangerous to human health than alcohol and tobacco.
docs.abstract: Editorial examines scientific findings on health effects of marijuana use, including its potential dangers, addictive properties and impact on young people; contends that marijuana, while not harmless, is less damaging than legal substances alcohol and tobacco; asserts that risks associated with marijuana consumption are not reason enough to impose criminal penalties on its possession (Series: High Time).
docs.snippet: While marijuana is not harmless, it is less dangerous to human health than alcohol and tobacco.
